intro: Teclea sudanica, commonly known as Sudanese teclea, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa and parts of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Teclea sudanica grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry riverbeds. It has been traditionally used in local medicine for its purported healing properties.
